math
Class Fraction

java.lang.Object
  math.Fraction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
public class Fraction
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>

Fraction is just that, a fraction. It contains only integers and keeps itself as precise as possible.

Author:
Niels Thykier

public Fraction(int numerator,
                int denominator)
         throws java.lang.ArithmeticException
Creates a fraction with the initial values. Note: if the numerator is 0, the denominator will be reduced to 1!

Parameters:
numerator - The value of the numerator (top)
denominator - The value of the denominator (bottom)
Throws:
java.lang.ArithmeticException - if the denominator is 0.

reduce

public Fraction reduce()
Attempts to reduce the fraction. Note: If the numerator is 0, the denominator will be reduced to 1. While both the denominator and the numerator is equal, they will be divided with two. Once one (or both) no longer are equal it will start with the lowest of the two of them and find the highest possible value to divide them both with and if found, they will be divided with that.

Returns:
The reduced Fraction

divide

public Fraction divide(Fraction toDivide)
Divide this fraction with another fraction. This is done by reciprocalizing this fraction and then multiplying it with the other fraction.

Parameters:
toDivide - The fraction to divide with.
Returns:
The modified Fraction

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object arg0)
Compares the fraction with value (Integer, Long, Short, Double and another Fraction are supported) and returns -1,0,1 per rules of the compareTo(Object arg0) method defined in the Comparable interface. Note: For non-Fraction values, this is only as precise the double value allows it to be.

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
Parameters:
arg0 - To compare too.
Returns:
-1,0 or 1 if this object is less than, equal too or greather than the input.
